feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 21 at 8:21PM AKST until November 24 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Total snow accumulations of 4 to 9 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Skagway and the Klondike Highway. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning through Thursday morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Municipality of Skagway

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 21 at 8:21PM AKST until November 24 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 11 inches possible. * WHERE...Haines Borough and the Haines Highway. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning through Thursday morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Klukwan

entry.title: High Wind Watch issued November 21 at 7:39PM AKST until November 24 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Southeast winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 70 mph possible. * WHERE...Sitka, Port Alexander, Kake, Prince of Wales Island, Wrangell, Ketchikan, and Annette Island.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 21 at 5:01PM AKST until November 22 at 5:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. Visibility reduced to one half mile or less at times in blowing snow.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chukchi Sea Coast

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 21 at 5:01PM AKST until November 22 at 5:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Visibility reduced to one half mile or less at times in blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph.
entry.cap:areaDesc: St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 21 at 3:54PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: Another storm force low will move through the gulf Wed into Thu. The panhandle will begin to see impacts as the front approaches Wed. Wind gusts of 50 to 60 mph over land based areas and periods of heavy rain with total amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected. Sufficient cold air in place over the far northern panhandle that heavy snow is expected. A winter storm watch has been issued for
entry.cap:areaDesc: Admiralty Island; Annette Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Wrangell; City and Borough of Yakutat; City of Hyder; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Klukwan; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Municipality of Skagway; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island

entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Ward Lake * WHEN...Until 345 PM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas near Ward Lake.

entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM AKST TUESDAY... The Department of Environmental Conservation has issued an Air Quality Alert which is in effect until 5 AM AKST Tuesday. North Pole has a Stage 2 alert. Fairbanks has a Stage 1 alert. &&

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 21 at 8:25PM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Sanford affecting Seminole County. .The Saint Johns River at Sanford is forecast to slowly fall while remaining within Minor Flood Stage this week. Residents and interests along the river should expect a continuation of Minor flood impacts.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 21 at 8:24PM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Deland affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The Saint Johns River at DeLand is forecast to slowly fall while remaining in Minor Flood Stage this week. Residents and interests along the river should expect a continuation of Minor flood impacts. For the St. Johns River...including Deland...Moderate to Minor
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 21 at 8:22PM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Above Lake Harney affecting Seminole County. .The Saint Johns River above Lake Harney will continue a slow, steady decline this week within Minor Flood Stage. Residents and interests along the river should expect a continuation of Minor flood impacts.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 21 at 8:21PM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The Saint Johns River at Astor is forecast to continue a slow fall while remaining in Moderate Flood stage this week. Residents and interests along the river should expect a continuation of Moderate flood impacts.

entry.summary: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT... * WHAT...Saltwater flooding will persist across the Bayside communities of the Upper Keys. In fact, water levels continue to rise slowly. Subsiding water levels may begin as early as Wednesday. * WHERE...Upper Keys. * WHEN...Through Thursday afternoon.

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM TUESDAY TO 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. entry.summary: ...AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...An extended period of stagnant air, with light winds and little vertical mixing is expected. * WHERE...Portions of North and North Central Idaho. entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 21 at 2:31PM PST until November 23 at 4:00AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TUESDAY TO 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 3000 feet. entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 7 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 21 at 2:30PM PST until November 22 at 10:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 10 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...A chance of freezing rain is expected. Total ice accumulations of up to five hundredths of an inch possible, with heaviest accumulations north of the Tri-Cities. * WHERE...Lower Columbia Basin of Washington.

entry.summary: ...AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Poor air quality. * WHERE...Central, north central and northeast Oregon and central, south central and southeast Washington. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST Tuesday.
